content:
DataColumnMappingCollection Class

In this Article

Contains a collection of DataColumnMapping objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public sealed class DataColumnMappingCollection : MarshalByRefObject, System.Collections.IList, System.Data.IColumnMappingCollection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.MarshalByRefObject
  • DataColumnMappingCollection

Constructors

  • DataColumnMappingCollection()

    Creates an empty DataColumnMappingCollection.

    public DataColumnMappingCollection ();

    Example

    The following example creates a DataColumnMappingCollection collection, adds DataColumnMapping objects to the collection, and displays a list of the mapped source columns. 

        public void CreateColumnMappings() 
    {
        DataColumnMappingCollection mappings =
            new DataColumnMappingCollection();
        mappings.Add("Category Name","DataCategory");
        mappings.Add("Description","DataDescription");
        mappings.Add("Picture","DataPicture");
        string myMessage = "ColumnMappings:
    ";
        for(int i=0;i < mappings.Count;i++)
        {
            myMessage += i.ToString() + " " 
                + mappings[i].ToString() + "
    ";
        }
        Console.WriteLine(myMessage);
    }

     Public Sub CreateColumnMappings()
     Dim mappings As New DataColumnMappingCollection()
     mappings.Add("Category Name", "DataCategory")
     mappings.Add("Description", "DataDescription")
     mappings.Add("Picture", "DataPicture")
     Dim myMessage As String = "ColumnMappings:" + ControlChars.Cr
     Dim i As Integer
     For i = 0 To mappings.Count - 1
         myMessage += i.ToString() + " " + mappings(i).ToString() _
            + ControlChars.Cr
     Next i
     Console.WriteLine(myMessage)
 End Sub

Properties

  • Count

    Gets the number of DataColumnMapping objects in the collection.

    public int Count { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The number of items in the collection.

    Example

    The following example creates a DataColumnMappingCollection collection, adds DataColumnMapping objects to the collection, and displays a list of the mapped source columns. 

     Public Sub CreateColumnMappings()
     Dim mappings As New DataColumnMappingCollection()
     mappings.Add("Category Name", "DataCategory")
     mappings.Add("Description", "DataDescription")
     mappings.Add("Picture", "DataPicture")
     Dim message As String = "ColumnMappings:" + ControlChars.Cr
     Dim i As Integer
     For i = 0 To mappings.Count - 1
         message += i.ToString() + " " + mappings(i).ToString() _
            + ControlChars.Cr
     Next i
     Console.WriteLine(message)
 End Sub

        public void CreateColumnMappings() 
    {
        DataColumnMappingCollection mappings = 
            new DataColumnMappingCollection();
        mappings.Add("Category Name","DataCategory");
        mappings.Add("Description","DataDescription");
        mappings.Add("Picture","DataPicture");
        string message = "ColumnMappings:
    ";
        for(int i=0;i < mappings.Count;i++)
        {
            message += i.ToString() + " " 
                + mappings[i].ToString() + "
    ";
        }
        Console.WriteLine(message);
    }

    Gets or sets the DataColumnMapping object at the specified index.

    public System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping this[int index] { get; set; }

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the DataColumnMapping object to find.

    Property Value

    • DataColumnMapping

      The DataColumnMapping object at the specified index.

    Example

    The following example creates a DataColumnMappingCollection collection, adds DataColumnMapping objects to the collection, and displays a list of the mapped source columns. 

     Public Sub CreateColumnMappings()
     Dim mappings As New DataColumnMappingCollection()
     mappings.Add("Category Name", "DataCategory")
     mappings.Add("Description", "DataDescription")
     mappings.Add("Picture", "DataPicture")
     Dim message As String = "ColumnMappings:" + ControlChars.Cr
     Dim i As Integer
     For i = 0 To mappings.Count - 1

            + ControlChars.Cr

     Console.WriteLine(message)
 End Sub

        public void CreateColumnMappings() 
    {
        DataColumnMappingCollection mappings = 
            new DataColumnMappingCollection();
        mappings.Add("Category Name","DataCategory");
        mappings.Add("Description","DataDescription");

        string message = "ColumnMappings:
    ";
        for(int i=0;i < mappings.Count;i++)

  • Item(String)

    Gets or sets the DataColumnMapping object with the specified source column name.

    public System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping this[string sourceColumn] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • sourceColumn
      String

      The case-sensitive name of the source column.

    Property Value

    • DataColumnMapping

      The DataColumnMapping object with the specified source column name.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping object with the given source column name within a DataColumnMappingCollection collection. If the DataColumnMapping exists, the example displays the name and the index of the mapping. If the mapping does not exist, the example displays an error. This example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection has been created. 

        public void FindDataColumnMapping() 
    {
        // ...
        // create columnMappings
        // ...
        if (!columnMappings.Contains("Description"))
            Console.WriteLine("Error: no such table in collection.");
        else
        {
            Console.WriteLine("Name {0}", 
                columnMappings["Description"].ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("Index: {0}", 
                columnMappings.IndexOf("Description").ToString());
        }
    }

     Public Sub FindDataColumnMapping()
     ' ...
     ' create columnMappings
     ' ...
     If Not columnMappings.Contains("Description") Then
         Console.WriteLine("Error: no such table in collection.")
     Else
        Console.WriteLine("Name: {0}", _
            columnMappings("Description").ToString())
        Console.WriteLine("Index: {0}", _
            columnMappings.IndexOf("Description").ToString())
     End If
 End Sub

Methods

  • Add(Object)

    Adds a DataColumnMapping object to the collection.

    public int Add (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object

      A DataColumnMapping object to add to the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of the DataColumnMapping object that was added to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidCastException

      The object passed in was not a DataColumnMapping object.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping object within the collection. If the mapping exists in the collection, it is removed. If the mapping does not exist within the collection, it is added to the collection and its index is displayed. The example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection and a DataColumnMapping object have been created. 

     Public Sub ChangedMyMind()
     ' ...
     ' create mappings and mapping
     ' ...
     If mappings.Contains(CType(mapping, Object)) Then
         mappings.Remove(CType(mapping, Object))
     Else
         mappings.Add(CType(mapping, Object))
         Console.WriteLine("Index of new mapping: " + _
            mappings.IndexOf(CType(mapping, Object)).ToString())
     End If
 End Sub

        public void ChangedMyMind() 
    {
        // ...
        // create mappings and mapping
        // ...
        if (mappings.Contains((Object) mapping))
            mappings.Remove((Object) mapping);
        else 
        {
            mappings.Add((Object) mapping);
            Console.WriteLine("Index of new mapping: "
                + mappings.IndexOf((Object) mapping));
        }
    }
  • Add(String,String)

    Adds a DataColumnMapping object to the collection when given a source column name and a DataSet column name.

    public System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping Add (string sourceColumn, string dataSetColumn);

    Parameters

    • sourceColumn
      String

      The case-sensitive name of the source column to map to.

    • dataSetColumn
      String

      The name, which is not case-sensitive, of the DataSet column to map to.

    Returns

    • DataColumnMapping

      The DataColumnMapping object that was added to the collection.

    Example

    The following example creates a DataColumnMappingCollection collection, adds DataColumnMapping objects to the collection, and displays a list of the mapped source columns. 

        public void CreateColumnMappings() 
    {
        DataColumnMappingCollection mappings =
            new DataColumnMappingCollection();
        mappings.Add("Category Name","DataCategory");
        mappings.Add("Description","DataDescription");
        mappings.Add("Picture","DataPicture");
        string myMessage = "ColumnMappings:
    ";
        for(int i=0;i < mappings.Count;i++)
        {
            myMessage += i.ToString() + " " 
                + mappings[i].ToString() + "
    ";
        }
        Console.WriteLine(myMessage);
    }

     Public Sub CreateColumnMappings()
     Dim mappings As New DataColumnMappingCollection()
     mappings.Add("Category Name", "DataCategory")
     mappings.Add("Description", "DataDescription")
     mappings.Add("Picture", "DataPicture")
     Dim myMessage As String = "ColumnMappings:" + ControlChars.Cr
     Dim i As Integer
     For i = 0 To mappings.Count - 1
         myMessage += i.ToString() + " " + mappings(i).ToString() _
            + ControlChars.Cr
     Next i
     Console.WriteLine(myMessage)
 End Sub

    Copies the elements of the specified Array to the end of the collection.

    public void AddRange (Array values);

    Parameters

    • values
      Array

      The Array to add to the collection.

  • AddRange(DataColumnMapping[])

    Copies the elements of the specified DataColumnMapping array to the end of the collection.

    public void AddRange (System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping[] values);

    Parameters

    • values
      DataColumnMapping[]

      The array of DataColumnMapping objects to add to the collection.

  • Clear()

    Removes all DataColumnMapping objects from the collection.

    public void Clear ();

    Example

    The following example exports the collection to an array of DataColumnMapping objects. It then clears the collection, and returns true if the parameters are no longer persisting. This example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection has been created. 

     Public Function PushIntoArray() As Boolean
     ' ...
     ' create mappings
     ' ...
     Dim columns As DataColumnMapping()
     mappings.CopyTo(columns, 0)
     mappings.Clear()
     PushIntoArray = True
 End Function

        public bool PushIntoArray() 
    {
        // ...
        // create mappings
        // ...
        DataColumnMapping[] columns = new DataColumnMapping[0];
        mappings.CopyTo(columns, 0);
        mappings.Clear();
        return true;
    }
  • Contains(Object)

    Gets a value indicating whether a DataColumnMapping object with the given Object exists in the collection.

    public bool Contains (object value);

    Parameters

    • value
      Object

      An Object that is the DataColumnMapping.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the collection contains the specified DataColumnMapping object; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidCastException

      The object passed in was not a DataColumnMapping object.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping within the collection. If the mapping exists in the collection, it is removed. If the mapping does not exist within the collection, it is added to the collection and its index is displayed. The example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection and a DataColumnMapping object have been created. 

     Public Sub ChangedMyMind()
     ' ...
     ' create mappings and mapping
     ' ...
     If mappings.Contains(CType(mapping, Object)) Then
         mappings.Remove(CType(mapping, Object))
     Else
         mappings.Add(CType(mapping, Object))
         Console.WriteLine("Index of new mapping: " & _
            mappings.IndexOf(CType(mapping, Object)).ToString())
     End If
 End Sub

        public void ChangedMyMind() 
    {
        // ...
        // create mappings and mapping
        // ...
        if (mappings.Contains((Object) mapping))
            mappings.Remove((Object) mapping);
        else 
        {
            mappings.Add((Object) mapping);
            Console.WriteLine("Index of new mapping: " +
                mappings.IndexOf((Object) mapping));
        }
    }
  • Contains(String)

    Gets a value indicating whether a DataColumnMapping object with the given source column name exists in the collection.

    public bool Contains (string value);

    Parameters

    • value
      String

      The case-sensitive source column name of the DataColumnMapping object.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if collection contains a DataColumnMapping object with the specified source column name; otherwise, false.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping object with the given source column name within a DataColumnMappingCollection collection. If the DataColumnMapping exists, the example displays the name and the index of the mapping. If the mapping does not exist, the example displays an error. This example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection has been created. 

        public void FindDataColumnMapping() 
    {
        // ...
        // create columnMappings
        // ...
        if (!columnMappings.Contains("Description"))
            Console.WriteLine("Error: no such table in collection.");
        else
        {
            Console.WriteLine("Name {0}", 
                columnMappings["Description"].ToString());
            Console.WriteLine("Index: {0}", 
                columnMappings.IndexOf("Description").ToString());
        }
    }

     Public Sub FindDataColumnMapping()
     ' ...
     ' create columnMappings
     ' ...
     If Not columnMappings.Contains("Description") Then
         Console.WriteLine("Error: no such table in collection.")
     Else
        Console.WriteLine("Name: {0}", _
            columnMappings("Description").ToString())
        Console.WriteLine("Index: {0}", _
            columnMappings.IndexOf("Description").ToString())
     End If
 End Sub
  • CopyTo(Array,Int32)

    Copies the elements of the DataColumnMappingCollection to the specified array.

    public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      Array

      An Array to which to copy DataColumnMappingCollection elements.

    • index
      Int32

      The starting index of the array.

  • CopyTo(DataColumnMapping[],Int32)

    Copies the elements of the DataColumnMappingCollection to the specified DataColumnMapping array.

    public void CopyTo (System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      DataColumnMapping[]

      A DataColumnMapping array to which to copy the DataColumnMappingCollection elements.

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.

  • GetByDataSetColumn(String)

    Gets the DataColumnMapping object with the specified DataSet column name.

    public System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping GetByDataSetColumn (string value);

    Parameters

    • value
      String

      The name, which is not case-sensitive, of the DataSet column to find.

    Returns

    • DataColumnMapping

      The DataColumnMapping object with the specified DataSet column name.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping within the collection. If the object exists, it is returned. The example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection and a DataColumnMapping object have been created. 

     Public Sub FindDataColumnMapping()
     ' ...
     ' create mappings and mapping
     ' ...
     If mappings.IndexOfDataSetColumn("datadescription") <> - 1 Then
         mapping = mappings.GetByDataSetColumn("datadescription")
     End If
 End Sub

        public void FindDataColumnMapping() 
    {
        // ...
        // create mappings and mapping
        // ...
        if (mappings.IndexOfDataSetColumn("datadescription") != -1)
            mapping = mappings.GetByDataSetColumn("datadescription");
    }
  • GetColumnMappingBySchemaAction(DataColumnMappingCollection,String,MissingMappingAction)

    Gets a DataColumnMapping for the specified DataColumnMappingCollection, source column name, and MissingMappingAction.

    public static System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping GetColumnMappingBySchemaAction (System.Data.Common.DataColumnMappingCollection columnMappings, string sourceColumn, System.Data.MissingMappingAction mappingAction);

    Parameters

    • columnMappings
      DataColumnMappingCollection

      The DataColumnMappingCollection.

    • sourceColumn
      String

      The case-sensitive source column name to find.

    • mappingAction
      MissingMappingAction

      One of the MissingMappingAction values.

    Returns

    • DataColumnMapping

      A DataColumnMapping object.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The mappingAction parameter was set to Error, and no mapping was specified.

    Remarks

    If the DataColumnMapping exists in the collection, it is returned.

    If the DataColumnMapping does not exist in the collection, for a given MissingMappingAction, the following actions occur:

    MissingMappingAction Action Taken
    Passthrough Creates a DataColumnMapping with the specified source column name as both the source column name and the DataSet column name. This DataColumnMapping is not added to the collection.
    Error An InvalidOperationException is generated if the specified column mapping is missing.
    Ignore Gets a null value.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping with the given source column name within the collection. If the object exists, it is returned. The example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection and a DataColumnMapping object have been created. 

     Public Sub FindDataColumnMapping()
     ' ...
     ' create mappings and mapping
     ' ...
     If mappings.Contains("Description") Then
         mapping = _
            DataColumnMappingCollection.GetColumnMappingBySchemaAction _
            (mappings, "Description", MissingMappingAction.Ignore)
     End If
 End Sub

        public void FindDataColumnMapping() 
    {
        // ...
        // create mappings and mapping
        // ...
        if (mappings.Contains("Description"))
            mapping = DataColumnMappingCollection.GetColumnMappingBySchemaAction
                (mappings, "Description", MissingMappingAction.Ignore);
    }
  • GetDataColumn(DataColumnMappingCollection,String,Type,DataTable,MissingMappingAction,MissingSchemaAction)

    A static method that returns a DataColumn object without instantiating a DataColumnMappingCollection object.

    public static System.Data.DataColumn GetDataColumn (System.Data.Common.DataColumnMappingCollection columnMappings, string sourceColumn, Type dataType, System.Data.DataTable dataTable, System.Data.MissingMappingAction mappingAction, System.Data.MissingSchemaAction schemaAction);

    Parameters

    • columnMappings
      DataColumnMappingCollection

      The DataColumnMappingCollection.

    • sourceColumn
      String

      The case-sensitive column name from a data source.

    • dataType
      Type

      The data type for the column being mapped.

    • dataTable
      DataTable

      An instance of DataTable.

    • mappingAction
      MissingMappingAction

      One of the MissingMappingAction values.

    • schemaAction
      MissingSchemaAction

      Determines the action to take when the existing DataSet schema does not match incoming data.

    Returns

    • DataColumn

      A DataColumn object.

  • IndexOfDataSetColumn(String)

    Gets the location of the specified DataColumnMapping with the given DataSet column name.

    public int IndexOfDataSetColumn (string dataSetColumn);

    Parameters

    • dataSetColumn
      String

      The name, which is not case-sensitive, of the data set column to find.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The zero-based location of the specified DataColumnMapping with the given DataSet column name, or -1 if the DataColumnMapping object does not exist in the collection.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping within the collection. If the object exists, it is returned. The example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection and a DataColumnMapping object have been created. 

     Public Sub FindDataColumnMapping()
     ' ...
     ' create mappings and mapping
     ' ...
     If mappings.IndexOfDataSetColumn("datadescription") <> - 1 Then
         mapping = mappings.GetByDataSetColumn("datadescription")
     End If
 End Sub

        public void FindDataColumnMapping() 
    {
        // ...
        // create mappings and mapping
        // ...
        if (mappings.IndexOfDataSetColumn("datadescription") != -1)
            mapping = mappings.GetByDataSetColumn("datadescription");
    }

    public void Remove (object value);

      Object

      The Object that is the DataColumnMapping to remove.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidCastException

      The object specified was not a DataColumnMapping object.

    • ArgumentException

      The object specified is not in the collection.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping within the collection. If the mapping exists in the collection, it is removed. If the mapping does not exist within the collection, it is added to the collection and its index is displayed. The example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection and a DataColumnMapping object have been created. 

     Public Sub ChangedMyMind()
     ' ...
     ' create mappings and mapping
     ' ...
     If mappings.Contains(CType(mapping, Object)) Then
         mappings.Remove(CType(mapping, Object))
     Else
         mappings.Add(CType(mapping, Object))
         Console.WriteLine("Index of new mapping: " + _
            mappings.IndexOf(CType(mapping, Object)).ToString())
     End If
 End Sub

        public void ChangedMyMind() 
    {
        // ...
        // create mappings and mapping
        // ...
        if (mappings.Contains((Object) mapping))
            mappings.Remove((Object) mapping);
        else 
        {
            mappings.Add((Object) mapping);
            Console.WriteLine("Index of new mapping: "
                + mappings.IndexOf((Object) mapping));
        }
    }
  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes the DataColumnMapping object with the specified index from the collection.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index of the DataColumnMapping object to remove.

    Exceptions

    • IndexOutOfRangeException

      There is no DataColumnMapping object with the specified index.

    Example

    The following example searches for a DataColumnMapping object with the given index within a DataColumnMappingCollection collection. If the DataColumnMapping exists, the mapping is removed. This example assumes that a DataColumnMappingCollection collection has been created. 

    
    public void RemoveDataColumnMapping() 
    {
        // ...
        // create mappings
        // ...
        if (mappings.Contains(7))
            mappings.RemoveAt(7);
    }
